main event: Four disc-shaped objects were observed from a ground radar station between Tonopah and Las Vegas, Nevada on November 23, 1957, moving at a high rate of speed before disappearing behind low hills.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 20 minutes and raised the concern of optical illusion due to environmental conditions., The objects were tracked on radar even as they became invisible to the naked eye., Reports emerged indicating a possible deliberate hoax concerning the sightings., No other motorists in the area reported unusual airborne objects at the time of the sighting., The case prompted further analysis of the psychological state of the witness involved.
witness description: 1st Lt Joseph F. Long, an Air Force pilot who completed an advanced survival course shortly before the sighting.
